statusLeds.information: Monitors wheater or not each application is running or not. Check configuration or logfiles of you encounter any issues

startCasting.title: Simulate UAVcast startup sequence
startCasting.information: Test the startup sequence of enabled items. When Autostart is enabled, RPI will run this command automatically during bootup.

autostart.title: Enable Autostart
autostart.information: Enable if you want UAVcast to start automatically when raspberry boots up.

flightcontroller.title: Controller Type
flightcontroller.subTitle: Status LED
flightcontroller.fcTypeDescription: Choose a flight controller. All ardupilot versions and Px4 is supported.
flightcontroller.internal_address_description:
This is the internal address raspberry uses for communication with Flight Controller.
Only change if you know what you are doing!

tips.1: Its very important that both RPI and FC shares the same electrical ground if you have connected your FC to RPI GPIO, serial communication depends on that.
tips.2: If you experience issues using USB cable, make sure you have removed all other USB devices from RPI. Some USB devices could cause conflicts.

navio.launchOptionsDescription: Mapping between switches and serial ports.

groundControlStation.title: Ground Control Station
groundControlStation.subTitle: Add Ground Control Station IP address and port.
groundControlStation.subTitle1: NOTE! Adding Ground Control IP addresses only applies if UDP is selected for Telemetry or video

modem.title: Modem
modem.subTitle: Modem configuration
modem.enableText:
Enable cellular Modem?
Modem Manager is used to establish a carrier connection. You can find all supported devices
modem.modelDescription:
Choose between Stick or HiLink
Example: E3276H (Ending character)
HiLink modems uses embedded software to connect LTE / 4G network
modem.hilinkInterfaceDescription:
Set the HiLink modem interface name. This is normally eth1 for RPI 2/3 and eth0 for Pi0w.
LED will turn green if the interface has proper internet access.
modem.managerDescription: Select whether or not you want to use Network Manager or Modem Manager to manage the cell connection. Modems behaves diffrently, so test both options if you have issues. Its recommended to restart RPI if you change this option.
modem.stickInterfaceDescription:
Set the Stick modem interface name. This is normally either wwan0 or ppp0. You can see the interface name by pressing the network button below.
LED will turn green if the interface has proper internet access.
modem.apnDescription: An Access Point Name is the name of a gateway between a GSM, GPRS, 3G or 4G mobile network and another computer network, frequently the public Internet
modem.internalAddressDescription:
USB modem interal Address. USB modems usually get
cdc-wdm0. You can specify another address if needed.
modem.usernameDescription: Most carriers dont require any username or password, but some might.
modem.passwordDescription: Most carriers dont require any username or password, but some might.
modem.pinDescription: You sim pin code, unless you have disabled Pin Authorization

tips.title: Troubleshooting Tips
tips.1: HiLink modems will act the same way as an Ethernet cable. RPI will be online as soon as you insert the modem
tips.2: You can find all supported modems here https://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Software/ModemManager/SupportedDevices/

dynamicDns.title: DNS
dynamicDns.subTitle: Dynamic DNS configuration
dynamicDns.aliasDescription: Dns Alias is your newly created address
dynamicDns.dnsSystemDescription: DNS System is created by your host

tips.title: Troubleshooting Tips
tips.1: DDNS or DynamicDNS is a way to link a web url to a IP address. Its convenient if you want to connect remote partner with a dynamic IP.
tips.2: You can use free vendors such as https://www.noip.com, https://www.duckdns.org/

camera.title: Camera
camera.subTitle: Camera configuration
camera.tcpHostDescription: Add TCP Host IP address. This should be the Raspberry Pi ipadress.
camera.resolutionDescription: Higher resolution require more bandwith. As a thumb rule, HD(1280x720) would require 10Mb upload speed to achive good quality video
camera.bitrateDescription: Default : 1000000 or 1Mbits/s. Use bits per second, so 10Mbits/s would be 10000000. For H264, 1080p30 a high quality bitrate would be 15Mbits/s or more. Maximum bitrate is 25Mbits/s (25000000), but much over 17Mbits/s won't show noticeable improvement at 1080p30.
camera.rotationDescription: Sets the rotation of the image in the viewfinder and resulting image. This can take any value from 0 upwards, but due to hardware constraints only 0, 90, 180, and 270 degree rotations are supported
camera.contrastDescription: Sets the contrast of the image. 0 is the default
camera.brightnessDescription: Sets the brightness of the image. 50 is the default. 0 is black, 100 is white
camera.autowhitebalanceDescription: Default Value: Auto. Modes for which colour temperature ranges (K) are available have these settings in brackets.
camera.framesPrSecondDescription: Default value = 20. At present, the minimum frame rate allowed is 2fps, and the maximum is 30fps
camera.cameraFlipDescription: Select the image orientation. Horizontal or vertical flip.
camera.httplivestreamDescription:
Recommended settings for In-Browser live stream
FPS => 10 - 15
Resolution => 960x540

tips.title: Tips
tips.1:
Select custom pipeline and add this code to generate a test video stream. Nice to test without a camera connected. Change the IP and Port to match your settings
gst-launch-1.0 videotestsrc ! x264enc ! video/x-h264, stream-format=byte-stream ! rtph264pay ! udpsink host=192.168.1.100 port=5600
tips.2: Mission planner and QGroundControl will automatically detect video stream on port 5600
tips.3:
To receive UDP video feed on a Windows computer, install gstreamer and use this pipeline. Remember to change the port to match your setting.
gst-launch-1.0 -v udpsrc port=5600 caps='application/x-rtp, media=(string)video, clock-rate=(int)90000, encoding-name=(string)H264' ! rtpjitterbuffer ! rtph264depay ! avdec_h264 ! videoconvert ! autovideosink sync=false
tips.4:
To receive TCP (Only for PiCam) video on Windows computer, install gstreamer and use this pipeline. Remember to change the port and host to match your setting.
gst-launch-1.0 -v tcpclientsrc host='Pi-IP' port=5600 ! gdpdepay ! rtph264depay ! avdec_h264 ! videoconvert ! autovideosink sync=false

vpn.title: VPN
vpn.subTitle: Virtual Private Network
vpn.configurationDescription:
Your openvpn configuration file.
See VPN help section on how to generate / download this file

tips.title: Tips
tips.1: To utilize Zerotier VPN, please refer to their`s documentation on how to install and connect VPN networks.
tips.2: Google provides an easy way to launch a openvpn server. Read more here https://openvpn.net/index.php/access-server/on-google-cloud.html

license.title: License
license.subTitle:
You can activate your license key as many times you want, there are no limitation, only a expire date.
Raspberry Pi will contact our license server uppon registration, make sure you have proper internet connection.
license.supportText: Please feel free to contact us if you need any further information

applicationVersion.title: Version
applicationVersion.subTitle: Application overview
applicationVersion.upgradeSuccess: Installation complete, please refresh the page.
applicationVersion.newversionExist: You already have the latest version

applicationSettings.title: Settings
applicationSettings.darkThemeDescription: Change between Light or Dark scheme
applicationSettings.serverMessagesDescription: Get real time messages from the server, such as undervoltage, CPU throttling. It will be highlighted in the header section
applicationSettings.serverPortDescription:
Change the default server port. Standard port 80.
Do not change if you dont know what you are doing!
applicationSettings.resetLogfilesDescription: Logfiles will accumulate over time and it could be usefull to erase them if you troubleshooting an issue.
applicationSettings.resetDatabaseDescription: This will not erase userdata such as license, but all configurations will be lost.
applicationSettings.restoreDescription:
Restore database from an earlier backup. (.zip)
NOTE! All current config will be overwritten.

rebootNotification.title: Do you want to Restart Raspberry PI
rebootNotification.content: Make sure you have saved everything!

shutdownNotification.title: Do you want to shutdown Raspberry PI
shutdownNotification.content: Make sure you have saved everything!

customTerminal.title: Custom Terminal
customTerminal.helpText: example, type ls to list all files in the main directory

tips.title: Troubleshooting Tips
tips.1: If you encounter any problems then please Download log files and contact then application owner

hostname.title: Hostname
hostname.description: A hostname is the label assigned to your RPI. Its used to distinguish one device from another on a network. You can access your RPI using the hostname instead of IP address. Default name is raspberrypi

interface.title: Interfaces
interface.description:
You will find all active interfaces below. Box with green outline is your default connection to the outer world.
Do not change any values while in flight, this might disconnect you from the vehicle.

route.title: Default network route
route.pre-description: Raspberry Pi is currently using gateway
route.post-description: to access the World Wide Web.
route.description:
You can specify another default interface from the dropdown bellow. Only physical devices can be selected, not VPN or other bridged interface.
Raspberry will still use other interfaces, but priority the one you select as first option.

wifi.title: WiFi Network
wifi.description: Disconnect wifi adapter temporarily. It will re-connect during next startup.
wifi.connecttext: Press the network name you want to connect to.

modal.title: Warning!
modal.description:
You are about to disconnect WiFI interface.
Make sure you are connected by other means if you want to stay connected.
Are you sure you want to proceed?

led.title: LED Control
led.statusLedSubTitle:
Select a status to enable the onboard status (green) LED.
Note! Not all boards is equiped with status LED.
led.powerLedSubTitle: Select a status to enable the onboard power (red) LED.
